info.name: Punt Club API v3
info.description:
This document provides documentation for developers to interface with Punt Club. The API was designed for but not 
limited to use with the Punt Club mobile app.

## Terminology
* **Partial accounts** are conversation tracking accounts that are used until the user registers their Punt Club account.
* **Punt Club accounts** are the accounts users use to login to puntclub.com
* **Bookie accounts** are betting accounts registered with our affiliate (ie Luxbet or Ladbrokes)
* **Club User accounts** are unique to each club the user is in.

## Conventions
* Keys are snake case.
* Constant values are uppercase when strings.
* HTTP codes are respected but should not be relied on, instead check the `api_response` constants.

## Usage
**DEV URL**: https://staging.puntclub.com

**PROD URL**: https://puntclub.com  

All API resources are prefixed with path: `/api/v3`   

All requests must be transmitted securely via `HTTPS`.

item.name: Auth
item.description: Methods for instantiating and maintaining API access.

urlencoded.description: The users Punt Club email address.

request.description:
Logs a user into their Punt Club account.

The payload contains the auth_token that can be used to authorise all secured end-points.

Assign the token to the `X-PUNTCLUB-AUTH` header for future authorised requests.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - An `auth_token` will be included in the payload.
2. `BAD_REQUEST` - Invalid username or password.

urlencoded.description: The users Punt Club email address.
The users new password (string. min: 8, max: 32)
The verification token that was email to the user.

request.description:
Resets a Punt Club account password.

The token provided will have been emailed to the user by posting email to this path.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - The password was reset.
2. `INVALID_VERIFY_TOKEN` - The token is invalid (expired or otherwise).
3. `INVALID_PASSWORD` - The password is invalid - see password requirements.

Requests a password reset for a Punt Club account.

This will email the user a link they can use to reset their password. The token is short lived (15 minutes).

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - A password reset email has been delivered
2. `UNKNOWN_ACCOUNT` - The email address is not registered

response.name: Success
response.body: {"result":"SUCCESS","api_response":"OK","api_message":"The request was successful.","payload":[],"messages":["Password reset request successful, please check email."]}

request.description:
Expires an API so that it can no longer be used.

Best practice is to invoke this after a user logs out the application.

This method expires the API key assigned to the `X-PUNTCLUB-AUTH` header.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - The API key was expired.
2. `NO_MODIFIED` - The API key is already expired.
3. `BAD_REQUEST` - Ensure the `X-PUNTCLUB-AUTH` header has been set.

Exchange the API key for a new once.

On success, the existing API key will be expired and can no longer be used to susequent requests.

**API Response Codes**
* `OK` - The API key was renewed
* `BAD_REQUEST` - The API key provided was invalid or expired.

Query our system for the existance of accounts.

Must provide a query parameter named 'query' and the value must be a key:value pair, seperated by a semicolon.

Accepted keys are:
* `email` - The users email address.
* `facebook` - The users unique Facebook ID.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The query was executed without error, the payload will contain the result.
* `BAD_REQUEST` - There were one or more bad parameters.

response.name: Facebook Success

urlencoded.description: The users Punt Club password (string, min: 6, max: 32). Must contain letters and numbers.
The users first name (string, min: 2, max: 64).
The users last name (string,. min: 2, max: 64).
Date of Birth Day (integer, min: 1, max: 31).
Date of Birth Month (integer, min: 1, max: 12).
Date of Birth Year (integer, min: 1910, max: [now]).

request.description:
Creates a Punt Club user account.

Only 1 Punt Club account should be registered per user. The email address is the unique key and cannot be registered more than once.

If the user has gone down the standard funnel, they should have a partial ID used for conversion purposes. This should be provided on the query param.

If any validation errors occur, these will be mapped to the key with the error message. See the example request/responses for all parameters.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - The account was registered.
2. `EMAIL_ALREADY_REGISTERED` - The email address belongs to another account.
3. `USER_AUTHENTICATED` - The user is already signed in.
3. `BAD_REQUEST` - There were one or more validation errors - see payload.

urlencoded.description: The users Punt Club password (string, min: 6, max: 32). Must contain letters and numbers.
The users first name (string, min: 2, max: 64).
The users last name (string,. min: 2, max: 64).
Date of Birth Day (integer, min: 1, max: 31).
Date of Birth Month (integer, min: 1, max: 12).
Date of Birth Year (integer, min: 1910, max: [now]).

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

request.description:
Get a Punt Club account.

Users will only be able to fetch their own account - attempting to get any other account will result in an `ACCESS_DEINED` response.

Admins can fetch any account.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - Returns the users account as the payload.
2. `ACCESS_DENIED` - Attempting to load an account user does not have permission to.
3. `NOT_FOUND` - The given account ID does not exist.

request.description: Update a Punt Club account.
Get a Punt Club account settings.
Update a Punt Club account settings.

Associates a bookie account with a Punt Club user.

This action assumes that you have already validated the login using `/bookies/verify`. This method will succeed even if the login is invalid.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `OK` - The account was linked.
2. `BAD_REQUEST` - There was one or more bad parameters.

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

urlencoded.description: The bookie to register with (string, const).
Answer to security question (Luxbet accounts only)
The users Punt Club password (string, min: 6, max: 32). Must contain letters and numbers.
The users first name (string, min: 2, max: 64).
The users last name (string,. min: 2, max: 64).
Date of Birth Day (integer, min: 1, max: 31).
Date of Birth Month (integer, min: 1, max: 12).
Date of Birth Year (integer, min: 1910, max: [now]).
Passport or Drivers License (string, max: 128). (Luxbet accounts only)

request.description:
Registers a bookie account with one of our affiliates.

Our current affiliates are:
* Luxbet (key: `LUXBET`)
* Ladbrokes (key: `LADBROKES`)

Use the correspending key as the `bookie_id` value.

Some parameters are only required when registering with particular bookies - see individual parameter descriptions for more details.

**API Response Codes:**
1. `SUCCESS` - The account was registered.
2. `BAD_REQUEST` - There were one or more validation errors - see payload.

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

request.description:
Gets the account information for the given Bookie account.

Users can request the account information for their personal accounts and any club betting/kitty accounts they are connected to.

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.
The Punt Club authorisation key.

request.description:
Request login parameters to a registered Bookie account.

There are restrictions on when and which accounts are able to be logged into.

1. Personal accounts can only be logged into by the Punt Club accounts they belong to.
2. The Betting account can be logged into if:
    1. Its the club users turn to bet.
    2. The club user is the club caption.
3. The Kitty account can never be logged into by any club user.

The club caption may use the masquerade parameter to log into the Betting account and place bets on behalf of another club user.

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

request.description:
Verify a bookie login.

This is used prior to linking an account to verify the credentials are valid.

It may also be used in the sign-up process to pre-populate the personal details form.

**Api Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The credentials are valid, the payload will contain the personal details.
* `BAD_REQUEST` - Invalid username/password combination or malformed request.

request.description:
Returns the real-time balance for a given account.

This differs to the balance given in the Get Account action which returns a cached value.

An optional `defer` query parameter can be added to queue the balance check in the background (which will then be pushed to Firebase).

**API Response Codes**
* `OK` - The balance check was okay
* `ACCESS_DENIED` - User does not have access to that account
* `BAD_REQUEST` - Something went wrong in the balance check - see messages for more detail.

query.description: Optional. A club can be created from a partial conversion instead of providing a payload. Useful for sign ups.

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

urlencoded.description: The club name - must be unique. (string, min: 2, max: 100)
The amount to bet per period. (integer, min: 1, max: 100 when PERCENT)
The type in relation to bet_valuie. (string, const, DOLLARS | PERCENT)
Enables SMS when true, there is a cost per SMS. (boolean)
The bookie to signup with. (string, const, LUXBET | LADBROKES).
The number of punters betting at a time. (string, "all" or number)
The roi percentage a punter achieves in a period to bet again. (number)

request.description:
A user can register any number of clubs.

Each club must have a unique name and is registered with a bookie.

It is a pre-condition a personal betting account is linked prior to registering a club. If the user has not registered or linked their personal betting account with the nominated bookie, an error response will be returned.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK`: The club was registered and payload will include the `club_id`.
* `BOOKIE_NOT_LINKED`: The club could not be registered because the user has not linked the corresponding `bookie_id` account.
* `CLUB_NAME_USED`: The requested club name is already is use.
* `BAD_REQUEST`: The request contained one or more invalid values - preventable via client side.

response.name: Success

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

urlencoded.description: The club name - must be unique. (string, min: 2, max: 100)
The amount to bet per period. (integer, min: 1, max: 100 when PERCENT)
The type in relation to bet_valuie. (string, const, DOLLARS | PERCENT)
Enables SMS when true, there is a cost per SMS. (boolean)
The bookie to signup with. (string, const, LUXBET | LADBROKES).

urlencoded.description: The action to perform. See documentation for available options.

request.description:
Perform a club action. Generally only the club captian can perform these.

There are a few actions available as described below:
* `START_CLUB` - Starts a club. This must be performed once after the club has been created.
* `PAUSE_CLUB` - Pauses a club.
* `RESUME_CLUB` - Resumes a club.
* `OPT_IN_TRANSER` - Opt in to transfer to another bookie.
  * This request requires the `bookie_id` field
* `CHECK_TRANSFER` - Checks the pre-condition requires for an existing transfer.
* `START_TRANSFER` - Starts the transfer, this can only happen once the pre-conditions pass.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The request was successful.

header.description: The Punt Club authorisation key.

request.description:
Returns all the club meta data including name, statistics and leaderboard.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK`: The request was successful and the payload contains the leaderboard.
* `NOT_FOUND`: The specified club does not exist.
* `ACCESS_DENIED`: The user is not authorized to access that club.
Remove a Punt Club user from a club.

Query for the existance for club properties.

Values must be provided as key:value pairs as a query parameter.

**API Response Codes**
* `OK` - The query was successful, the payload contains the result.
* `BAD_REQUEST` - The query was in the incorrect format or supplied unsupported key/values.

request.description: Enrolls a club into a Competition.

Gets a Firebase auth token for the authenticated user.

This token is used with the Firebase SDK to authorise the user against the Punt Club realtime database.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The payload contains the auth token.

urlencoded.description: The device token provided by the Firebase SDK.

request.description:
Records a device token against the authenticated user.

This device will then be registered for push notifications. See the Firebase Cloud Messaging documentation for more information.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The device token was recorded.

query.description: Invite token unique to email invites.

request.description:
Gets the clubs invitation details which is useful to display to the user before they decide to accept the invitation.

This resource does not require authentication.

Note: `punters_per_period` in the payload is a string and could be numeric or "all".

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK`: The club details are returned in the payload.
* `NOT_FOUND`: That invitation does not exist.
* `ACCESS_DENIED`: The user is trying to access a invitation not meant for them.

query.description: Invite token unique to email invites.

request.description:
Invoke to accept a club invitiation. If successful, the user will be added to the club and they can then access the dashboard, setup their subscription etc.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The user was added to the club.
* `BOOKIE_NOT_LINKED` - The user must link the corresponding bookie account before they can join this club.
* `ALREADY_IN_CLUB` - The user is already in this club (have the already accepted the invitation?).
* `NOT_FOUND` - No invitation was found using those parameters.

Rejects a invitation to a club.

Once a invitation has been rejected, it cannot be used again. 

This is only applicable to private (email) invitations. Public URL invitations cannot be rejected.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The invitation was rejected.
* `NOT_FOUND` - The invitation does not exist.
* `NOT_MODIFIED` - The request was successful but no changes were made (ie a public URL invitation was provided).

Marks the notification as read.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The notification was marked read.
* `ACCESS_DENIED` - The authorized user does not have permission to that notification.
* `NOT_FOUND` - The notification does not exist.

Permenatly remove the notification from the users notification feed.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The notification was deleted.
* `ACCESS_DENIED` - The authorized user does not have permission to that notification.
* `NOT_FOUND` - The notification does not exist.

urlencoded.description: The users name (first name will do).
The users Facebook ID (provided by the SDK).
The users Facebook token (provided by the SDK).

request.description:
Forms part of the conversion process. Allows users frictionless access to the application and tracks their sign-up journey until they register their Punt Club account.

The payload should be inspected on a successful response to extract the partial user state. They could be a new sign-up or a returning user to complete the process.

The `partial[method]` key is required, the other fields provided will depend on this value.
* `EMAIL`: Provide `partial[name]` and `partial[email]`.
* `FACEBOOK`: Provide `partial[facebook_id]` and `partial[facebook_token]`.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The partial user was successfully registered.
* `USER_ALREADY_REGISTERED` - The details provided belong to a registered user, prompt to login instead.
* `OAUTH_TOKEN_INVALID` - The Facebook OAuth token is invalid or expired.
* `ACCESS_TOKEN_INVALID` - The Facebook Access token is invalid.
* `BAD_REQUEST` - The user provided one or more invalid inputs, check the payload for details.

Records sign up journey variables on the partial that can be used at a later time.

At the moment, only the club settings are recorded to the partial.

When the user creates their account and/or club, you can pass the partial ID as a query parameter. This helps track conversions and is convient (ie don't have to repeat the club settings in the request body if partial ID supplied).

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The partial was updated.
* `NOT_FOUND` - That partial does not exist.
* `PARTIAL_ALREADY_CONVERTED` - The partial cannot be updated because it has already been converted (ie user created an account).

item.name: Wall
item.description: Common methods for posting to a club wall.

formdata.description: Required. Optional is a attachment is include. The text content of the wall post. (string, min: 2, max: 1500)
Optional. The wall post may contain one image attachment to upload.

request.description:
Posts a new message to the club wall.

The message should contain plain/text content only. It's possible the user may paste URIs or add Emojis, this is acceptable. 

The content will be parsed server-side to handle any OG content.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The post was submitted. The response contains the new post id.
* `NOT_FOUND` - The user is trying to post to a club that does not exist.
* `ACCESS_DENIED` - The user is trying to post to a club they do not belong to.
* `BAD_REQUEST` - There are one or more invalid request parameters.

urlencoded.description: Required. The users comment. (string, min: 2, max: 1500).

request.description:
Post a comment to a wall message.

The wall message being posted to should be supplied to as a path param.

**API Response Codes:**
* `OK` - The comment was posted sucessfully.
* `NOT_FOUND` - The wall message does not exist.
* `ACCESS_DENIED` - The autenticated user is not allowed to comment on this post.
* `BAD_REQURED` - One or more invalid parameters (ie message too long).
